system.biography:
TitleFFF 507-4 Fighting Order MH
Birthday4 Kelen 698
AppearanceAge 22, height 5’ 10”, medium frame, weight 170 lb, size 6, attractive appearance, medium complexion, black hair, hazel eyes
Medical/PsycheNone
Size6
ArmorCloth hood, robe and leggings, leather knee boots, mail cowl, hauberk and mittens, cloth surcoat, plate half helm. Kite shield, broadsword and dagger. Add lance and medium warhorse as appropriate.
Other EquipmentLetter of introduction from the Chabla of the Lay of Paladins naming him as an erana (wandering knight)
Valuables112d in silver in a money pouch, silver holy symbol (75d) worn on a chain around his neck
NotesHe rides a gorgeous Reksyni warhorse named Wyndham (Initiative 70). Wyndham is 10 years old and was a gift from Sir Tobrin.

Biography

Armand is the fifth child, and bastard son, of the Baron of Gimon, Sir Tobrin Jevasa. His mother was a beautiful domestic girl working in the kitchens. Sir Tobrin acknowledged the boy, much to his wife Chendra’s disgust. The baron saw to it that his son was raised properly. Armand had a tutor and was taught weapons skills by the Captain of the Guard. Despite being a familiar and popular fixture around the keep, no local knights were willing to take him on as a squire.

When Armand turned 16, Lady Chendra issued an ultimatum to her husband, either the boy goes or she would. The baron agreed to enrol him in a Laranian fighting order. Lady Chendra insisted it be as far away as possible and forbid her husband to let the boy sully his clan name. Sir Tobrin had his Laranian chaplain escort Armand to Cundras in Melderyn with a letter of acknowledgement, a generous donation and a request to enrol him as noble squire. The Solora Crusade had just started. Always short of knights and squires, the Lady of Paladins accepted him. In lieu of a clan name, Armand goes by the name of his place of his birth.

Just 16 when he arrived, Armand was immediately thrown into the Solora Crusade. He was squired to a skilled Kaldoric knight who trained him well and looked out for him. Armand completed the Tirannon (knighting ritual) in the summer of 719 TR. After the campaigning season ended, he requested permission to visit his father and mother in Kanday and to undertake a pilgrimage to the Abbey of Saint Marabrine and Saint Oswyn as an Erana (wandering knight). The other knights were shocked when the Chabla approved his request and provided him a letter of introduction. Some whisper it is because Sir Armand closely resembles Sir Enyel’s dead son.

Adventure Hooks

Reluctant Crusader: The PCs meet a young knight of the Lady of Paladins on the road. He is travelling between pilgrimage locations. The friendly young knight strikes up a conversation. His mood darkens if they ask how the crusade is going.

Inexperienced Paladin: The PCs are doing something dishonourable or which could be misinterpreted. Sir Armand feels honour bound to intervene, although unsure of himself, he is a formidable warrior if forced. Young or not, arriving authorities will likely take the side of a returning crusader.

Hero Worship: Sir Armand witnesses a knight PC doing a heroic act. He believes the PC is someone worth following. Sir Armand is seeking to redeem himself for what he did and saw in the crusade.

Credits

This character is taken from “Friends, Foes, and Followers, Vol. 1” on Lythia.com (https://www.lythia.com/game_aides/friends-foes-followers-volume-1/), by Kerry Mould, with illustrations by Richard Luscheck and Juha Makkonen, and is “fanon”, a derivative work of copyrighted material by Columbia Games Inc. and N. Robin Crossby.
